sc_cat_item_producer.description:
FaceOff is a Proof of Concept for an idea I have had for some time. I see some issues with traditional rating systems (e.g. five stars, X/10, etc.) for games:

  • Games get better or worse over time via regular updates, which is not reflected in ratings
  • Giving a game a number is arbitrary and inconsistent
  • Comparing games of different genres is like comparing apples and oranges
  • There is little incentive to rate games; people usually only rate things when they are mad

The FaceOff ranking system seeks to improve this by reducing the decisions required to rate a game to one; which is the better? Games gain or lose points as they are rated using the elo system, resulting in a value determined by the wisdom of the crowds. It also:

  • Makes rating fluid
  • Makes rating fun
  • Reduces bias of picking an arbitrary number

Please let me know what you think!

Other ideas I have include

  • Hype ladder for unreleased games, speculating on how good games will be
  • Multi-criteria ladder (up to 3, which was my OG concept)
  • 'All-time best' ladder
  • Expanding to other use cases (restaurants, movies, TV)
  • Tier rating (S-A-B-C-D) based on rating.
